summary: This bill, the Protecting and Preserving Social Security Act, amends Title II of the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Key provisions include the implementation of a Consumer Price Index for Elderly Consumers (CPI-E) to calculate cost-of-living adjustments, changes to how wages and self-employment income above the contribution and benefit base are determined for taxation, and the inclusion of surplus earnings in the Social Security benefit formula. The bill's effective dates vary, primarily impacting calculations in and after 2026.
